title: Restrap Race Hydration Vest
content:
Hydration vests have been used in ultra-endurance running circles for some time now, but only recently have they been introduced into cycling, specifically bikepacking races. Restrap announced its first foray into vest design with the Race Hydration Vest. Let’s check it out below.

Much like a runner’s vest, the Race Hydration Vest is designed to carry essentials including water (in a bladder), food, emergency items, and clothing. Restraps’ Race Hydration Vest is crafted from durable, high-quality materials, it withstands the rigours of outdoor exploration while providing reliable hydration on demand…

 

 

The Race Hydration Vest proved instrumental in Restrap’s North Race Campaign. Ambassador Josh Reid rode a grueling 315 miles (506 km) in 24 hours, with a mere 62 minutes of stopping time throughout. He achieved this by carrying all the nutrition and hydration with him, keeping stopping time to a minimum.

To learn more about The North Race, head to http://northrace.co.uk/.

Specs:

  • RRP: £139.99 / €167.99 / $189.99
  • Available in two sizes:
    Small/Medium & Large/XL
  • Unisex design to fit all genders
  • Weight – (without bladder)
    Small/Medium – 368g
    Large/XL – 380g
  • Bladder weight – 146g
  • Weight – (with bladder)
    Small/Medium – 515g
    Large/XL – 530g
  • Capacity – 5.5 Litres with 2L Bladder Capacity
    (7.5 Litres total)

See more on the Race Hydration Vest at Restrap.
